After thorough security analysis, I've identified several concerning issues.

```json
{
  "reviewer": "SENTINEL",
  "perspective": "security",
  "verdict": "FAIL",
  "confidence": 0.95,
  "summary": "Critical SQL injection vulnerability in user input handler.",
  "findings": [
    {
      "severity": "critical",
      "category": "injection",
      "file": "src/db/queries.ts",
      "line": 15,
      "title": "SQL injection via unsanitized input",
      "description": "User input is concatenated directly into SQL query string without parameterization.",
      "suggestion": "Use parameterized queries with $1, $2 placeholders."
    },
    {
      "severity": "major",
      "category": "authentication",
      "file": "src/middleware/auth.ts",
      "line": 33,
      "title": "Missing rate limiting on login endpoint",
      "description": "The login endpoint has no rate limiting, allowing brute force attacks.",
      "suggestion": "Add rate limiting middleware with exponential backoff."
    }
  ],
  "stats": {
    "files_reviewed": 5,
    "files_with_issues": 2,
    "critical": 1,
    "major": 1,
    "minor": 0,

  }
}
```
